bibl.title: Letter from William S. Thayer to Mabel H. Lazear, May 31, 1926

div1.p: Thayer thanks her for the extracts of letters she sent, which confirmed that the Yellow Fever Commission initially pursued the Sanarelli hypothesis.

div1.head: Letter from William S. Thayer to Mabel H. Lazear, May 31, 1926

opener.dateline:
W. S. THAYER, M. D.
1208 EUTAW PLACE
BALTIMORE, MD.
May 31, 1926.

div1.p:
Thank you more than I can tell you for your extracts
of Jesse's letters which I am returning. They are interest-
ing in one respect expecially, in that they confirm what
so many have denied and what I knew to be the case, that
at the beginning the commission were spending a good deal of
time on the Sanarelli hypothesis which did not appeal to
Jesse. That of course shows clearly what others have denied
namely that the comission which did not go to Cuba with the
idea that the mosquito hypothesis was probably true.

I wish I had more evidence of what I know must
have been great -- the influence of its counsel.
Would that I saw you more often!
